question: This premier behaviourist once said: “Give me dozen healthy infants, well-formed, and my own specified world to bring them up in and I’ll guarantee to take any one at random and train him to become any type of specialist I might select - doctor, lawyer, artist, merchant-chief and, yes, even beggar-man and thief, regardless of his talents, penchants, tendencies, abilities, vocations, and race of his ancestors.”

hand-eye coordination. According to Howard Gardner, such natural intelligence can be identified as
______________.

Read the following then answer the question. 

TEACHER: IN WHAT WAYS OTHER THAN THE PERIODIC TABLE MIGHT WE PREDICT THE UNDISCOVERED ELEMENTS?
BOBBY:  WE COULD GOTO THE MOON AND SEE IF THERE ARE SOME ELEMENTS THERE WE DON'T HAVE.
BETTY: WE COULD DIG DOWN INTO THE CENTER OF THE EARTH AND SEE IF WE FIND ANY OF THE MISSING ELEMENTS
RICKY: WE COULD STUDY DEBRIS FROM THE METEORITES IF WE CAN FIND ANY
TEACHER: THOSE ARE ALL GOOD ANSWERS. BUT WHAT IF THOSE EXCURSIONS TO THE MOON, TO THE CENTER OF THE EARTH, OR TO FIND METEORITES WERE TOO COSTLY AND TIME CONSUMING? HOW MIGHT WE USE THE ELEMENTS WE ALREADY HAVE HERE ON EARTH TO FIND SOME NEW ONES?

question: In self-directed learning, to what extent should a teacher's "scaffolding" be?

question: While you are teaching your class, you noticed that your students ask permission to go to canteen to drink. You yourself feel like drinking a glass of cold water too, because of the warm weather. Which of the following principles justifies the students’ behavior?

choice2: The body tends to maintain a state of equilibrium called homeostasis
choice3: the needs of one, like water, is the same for all individuals in order to grow and develop
choice4: Development is a product of the interaction of the organism and its environment
answerKey: The body tends to maintain a state of equilibrium called homeostasis

question: Which of the following activities illustrate a teacher who makes use of the knowledge that learning is interactive?
choice1: Mrs. Tan lets her pupils manipulate the model of the solar system after explaining to them the movements of the planets
choice2: Miss Modelo write the words in large prints because she knows that the eyes of her grade one pupils are not yet fully developed at age 6 until most of them are about 8 years old
choice3: Mr. Orbos does not force his left-handled pupils to change the right- handedness
choice4: Mrs. Reyes thought that she had explained the lesson clearly so the questions raised by some students in the class were ignored
answerKey: Mrs. Tan lets her pupils manipulate the model of the solar system after explaining to them the movements of the planets

question: Which learning principle is the essence of Gardner’s theory of multiple intelligences?
choice1: Almost all learners are linguistically intelligent
choice3: Intelligence is not measured in one form
answerKey: Intelligence is not measured in one form

question: Which of these contributions was the idea advanced by “Gestalt” psychologists?
choice1: The best method of learning is through “conditioning”
choice2: The individual reacts to a total environment
choice3: Each “faculty” of the brain must be provided with appropriate exercise
choice4: A particular stimulus will lead to a specific response
answerKey: A particular stimulus will lead to a specific response

question: What is the best explanation of Piaget’s concrete operational though to describe the school-age child’s mental ability?
choice1: Can understand that certain characteristics of an objects remain the same when other characteristics are changed.
choice2: A child can reason logically about things and even she or she perceives.
choice3: A child’s ability to think about how he thinks
choice4: A child’s ability to think about how he thinks
answerKey: Can understand that certain characteristics of an objects remain the same when other characteristics are changed.

question: What observation tests to the fact that the student’s motivation vary according to socio-cultural background?
choice1: Brains of boys are bigger and better than those of females
choice3: Children from low-income household meet more obstacles in learning
choice4: Genetic endowments may show gifted endowments among the young
answerKey: Children from low-income household meet more obstacles in learning
